intro: Palicourea heteroneura, commonly known as the Brazilian starapple, is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is native to tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 5 meters in height, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically green when unripe and turn yellow or red when mature. Its botanical features include a smooth, often glabrous stem and flowers that are usually white or pale pink in color.
